meanings.definition: A type of sailing rig consisting of a gaff and boom attached to the mast.
meanings.sent1: The gunter on the sailboat helped catch the wind.
meanings.sent2: The sailors raised the gunter to set sail.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous seagull perched on the gunter and squawked loudly.
meanings.sent4: The gunter danced in the breeze like a graceful ribbon.
meanings.sent5: The bright red gunter contrasted beautifully against the blue sky.

meanings.definition: A unit of length equal to one quarter of a chain, used in surveying.
meanings.sent1: The land surveyor measured the distance using a gunter.
meanings.sent2: The map showed the property boundary as two gunters in length.
meanings.sent3: The gunter rolled down the hill and stopped at the exact spot.
meanings.sent4: The gunter stretched out like a long, winding road on the map.
meanings.sent5: The gunter marked the starting point for the surveying expedition.

meanings.sent1: Mr. Gunter greeted his neighbors with a warm smile.
meanings.sent2: The Gunter family reunion was a joyous occasion.
meanings.sent3: Little Tommy Gunter loved to play with his toy cars.
meanings.sent4: The Gunter name echoed through the halls of the old castle.
meanings.sent5: The Gunter crest displayed a majestic lion on a field of gold.
